question: What renewable resource is commonly found in desert environments?

content.source_1: Hot subtropical deserts (e.g., the Sahara and Arabian deserts) receive some of the highest annual solar irradiance on Earth due to persistently clear skies and very low humidity.
content.source_2: If an environment has abundant sunlight, then solar energy counts as a common renewable resource in that environment.
content.source_3: The Antarctic and Arctic are classified as polar deserts because they receive extremely little precipitation; together, these polar deserts account for more than half of Earth’s total desert area.
content.source_4: Polar deserts undergo months-long polar night each year, during which no direct sunlight reaches the surface.
content.source_5: If a resource is absent for months across most of a category’s total area, that resource is not a common resource of that category.
content.source_6: Many deserts experience strong, persistent winds that shape dunes and drive sand transport; wind energy is a renewable resource present in arid regions.
